data.title: Family Notices from Jersey Evening Post
data.meta_description: Search and book family announcements including birth, anniversary, engagement, marriage and death notices in Jersey, Channel Islands.
data.text:
Passed away at L’Hermitage Nursing Home on Tuesday, 20 August, 2024, much-loved husband of Joan (née Carre), loving Dad of Rudi, step-father of Karl, father-in-law to Joanne and Jasmine and Grandad of Evie and Lily. Will be sadly missed by family and friends.

Funeral details to follow.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 499444.

Passed away suddenly on Sunday, 18 August, 2024, aged 79 years. He will be deeply missed by his sister Sandra, brother-in-law Peter, nieces Faye, Lisa and her partner Jason.

You leave us with so many happy memories.

Forever in our thoughts.

Passed away peacefully on Friday, 16 August, 2024 in the care of Jersey Hospice, aged 83 years, beloved wife of Paul, much-loved and respected Mum to Peter and Nigel, adored Gran to Jasmine, Topaz and Cameron and great-grandmother to Luna Freya. Patricia will be so sadly missed by all her family and friends.

Funeral Service

A private funeral service will be taking place.

Family flowers only.

Donations in Patricia’s memory may be offered to Jersey Hospice Care, Mont Cochon, St Helier.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away suddenly and unexpectedly on Sunday, 18 August, 2024, aged 79 years, in the presence of his family at the Jersey General Hospital. He will be greatly missed by his loving partner Mary, sons Stephen and his wife Elizabeth and Andrew and his fiancée Amanda, grandchildren Connor, William, Amelie and Max, sister Sandra, brother-in-law Peter and all his nieces.

Funeral details to follow.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 01534 499444.

Passed away peacefully on Friday, 16 August, 2024, aged 93 years, much-loved Mum of David, Gary and Jayne. Reunited with her loving husband Graeme.

Funeral Services

Relatives and friends wishing to attend the funeral service for Mickie are invited to meet at the Crematorium Chapel, Westmount Road, St Helier on Thursday, 5 September at 2.30 pm.

Family flowers only please.

Donations in lieu of flowers in memory of Mickie can be made to The Good Companions Club, c/o The Manager, Angela Falle, Rue de Maupertuis, St Clement, JE2 6NG.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully aged 95 on Wednesday, 14 August, 2024 in the wonderful care of the Les Charrieres family.

Golf professional at the La Moye Golf Club from March 1969 until his retirement. Long standing member of the PGA. He will be greatly missed by his loving family, friends and those he taught and inspired.

Now at peace and with his beloved late wife Carole.

Funeral details to follow

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Aged 69 years.

Pat passed away suddenly on Tuesday, 30 July, 2024 at home. A loving and dedicated Dad to Kevin, brother to Joan and uncle to Andrea, Ian, Jack and Harry. Pat will be greatly missed by all his family and many friends.

Funeral Service

Relatives and friends wishing to attend the funeral service for Pat are invited to meet at Jersey Crematorium on Thursday, 29 August at 2.30 pm.

Family flowers only please.

Donations, if desired, in memory of Pat to Headway Jersey, Springfield Road, St Saviour, Jersey, Channel Isles, JE2 7DN.

All inquiries to Maillards, Funeral Directors, telephone 737291.

Passed away peacefully in the care of the Jersey General Hospital on Monday, 5 August, 2024, aged 81, a much-loved and adored Mum and friend to many. Janet will be sadly missed by her family and friends.

Funeral Service

A celebration for Janet’s life will be held in St Peters Parish Church on Monday, 2 September at 11 am and to gather in the Parish hall after the service to continue sharing memories of Janet.

No mourning clothes by request.

Family flowers only.

Donations in Janet’s memory can be offered to Durrell Wildlife Conservation Trust, c/o Judith Freeman, Durrell, Les Augres Manor, La Profonde Rue, Trinity, JE3 5BP.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully on Sunday, 11 August, 2024 in the care of Jersey Hospice, aged 81 years, devoted husband of 61 years to Anne, much-loved father to Sharon, Lisa and the late Carl, father-in-law to Paul and adored Papa to Lucy and Katie. John will be missed by everyone that knew him.

Funeral Service

Family and friends wishing to attend the funeral service for John are invited to meet in the Crematorium Chapel on Wednesday, 11 September at 1 pm.

Family flowers only please.

Donations can be made in Johns memory to Jersey Hospice Care, Mont Cochon, St Helier.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully at the Hospice, surrounded by her loving family, after a short illness on Friday, 16 August, 2024, aged 82 years, beloved wife of the late Graham, much-loved Mum, Nannie and Nanan who will be greatly missed.

Love you to the moon and back.

Funeral Service

Josie’s funeral service will take place on Friday, 30 August at 2.30 pm in the Crematorium Chapel, Westmount.

No mourning clothes.

Family flowers only.

Donations in Josie’s memory can be offered to Jersey Hospice Care, Mont Cochon, St Helier, JE2 3JB.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Anna would like to thank everyone who attended Jacks funeral, especially those she didn’t thank in person. All those who sent letters, cards with uplifting words and sentiments. Also those able to attend the RCIYC afterwards, the club team for the gentle and kind service and chefs fine food. Gratitude to Reverend Brendan Flaxman for his assistance prior to and conducting the service so ably, as well as the organist and choir. Thanks also to De Gruchy’s, Leah and all her colleagues involved. Finally to the Clarkson House team for helping us both through our last hours together.

Sadly passed away on Saturday, 20 July, 2024, aged 89 years, beloved husband of the late Helen, a loving Dad of Dave and his wife Samm and a wonderful Grandpa of Tiani and Kyla. He will be greatly missed by all his family and friends.

Donations in Dennis’ memory may be given to WWF at https://support.wwf.org.uk/donate

A private funeral has taken place.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 499444.

Relatives and friends wishing to attend the funeral service for Kathleen are invited to meet at St Clement’s Parish Church on Tuesday, 3 September at 11 am, followed by private burial.

No black clothing please.

No flowers by request.

Donations in lieu of flowers, in memory of Kathleen can be made to The JSPCA, c/o The Administrator, 89 St Saviour’s Road, St Helier, JE2 4GJ or Macmillan Cancer Support (Jersey) The Oasis, Suite 2.13 the Lido Medical Centre, St Saviour’s Road, St Saviour, Jersey, JE2 7LA.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Relatives and friends wishing to attend the funeral service for Janet, are warmly invited to meet at the Jersey Crematorium on Tuesday, 27 August at 1 pm.

Please wear bright colours.

Family flowers only.

Donations in lieu of flowers, if desired, may be sent to Jersey Hospice Care, Clarkson House, Mont Cochon, St Helier, JE2 3JB or Battersea Dogs and Cats Home, Special Gifts Team, Battersea Dogs and Cats Home, 4 Battersea Park Road, London, SW8 4AA.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 499444.

Passed away peacefully in the loving care of Jersey General Hospital and St Joseph’s Nursing Home, surrounded by his family, on Saturday, 17 August, 2024, aged 102 years, beloved husband of the late Mary, a loving father of Jean, Jane and Jon and Grandad of Loxie. He will be greatly missed by all his family and friends.

Funeral details to follow.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 499444.

Passed away peacefully on Saturday, 10 August, 2024, with her family around her. She bravely and acceptingly fought a full ten years of medical conditions, which she did with dignity. She left her daughters Karen and Nicky, friend to Charlton, Nanny to Lawrence and Emma and in a few short months would have met her first great-granddaughter of which she was very excited.

Positive Steps cared for her at home, which was her wish, and the carers became strong friends. Our thanks to the staff of Plemont Ward for looking after all of us in her last few days, especially during her time with oncology, the love, support and friendship they gave, but most of all to Dr Rubin Soomal.

Funeral details to follow.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully on Sunday, 11 August, 2024 in the presence of his family at the Jersey General Hospital ICU, aged 85 years. Loving husband to the late Carmen Manti, beloved father to Sebastian, Tony, Pili, Tom and Ignacio, loving father-in-law to Dawn, Neil and Susan and adored grandfather (Nonno) to Joshua, Leona, Julian and Corentin. Tommaso was greatly loved and will be missed every day.

The family would like to thank everyone involved with Tommaso’s exceptional care in the ICU during his last weeks in the hospital.

‘Sanctum’ by Beulah B Malkin.

I built a tiny garden, in a corner of my heart,

I kept it just for lovely things and bade all else depart.

And ever was there music and flowers blossomed fair,

And never was it perfect, until you entered there.

Fondest memories of a special Dad who passed away one year ago.

We think of you in silence, we often speak your name,

But all we have are memories and your picture in a frame.

Your resting place we visit and put flowers there with care,

But no one knows the heartache, as we turn and leave you there.

Forever in our hearts and thoughts.

Love always, Rob and Lynda, Richard and Marion xxxx.

Papa, we miss you more than words can express.

Loved and remembered every day, Rachel, Matthew and Joe xxx.

In loving memory of my Big Sister Jean.

‘Sisters, sisters never were there such devoted sisters’.

You always were and always will be, my inspiration and special Guiding star.

Your ever-loving Little Sister Ruth.
